d4e1d5db-6878-45b9-a842-65c4409dfcdf:
A barbarian can call upon inner reserves of strength and ferocity, granting her additional combat prowess. At 1st level, a barbarian can rage for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 4 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. For each level after 1st she possesses, the barbarian can rage for 2 additional rounds per day. Temporary increases to Constitution, such as that gained from bear's endurance, do not increase the total number of rounds that a barbarian can rage per day. A barbarian can enter a rage as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. The total number of rounds of rage per day is renewed after resting for 8 hours, although these hours need not be consecutive.
While in a rage, a barbarian gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. In addition, she takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. She also gains 2 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}. These temporary hit points are lost first when a character takes damage, disappear when the rage ends, and are not replenished if the barbarian enters a rage again within 1 minute of her previous rage. While in a rage, a barbarian cannot cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
A barbarian can end her rage as a free {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, and is fatigued for 1 minute after a rage ends. A barbarian can't enter a new rage while fatigued or exhausted, but can otherwise enter a rage multiple times per day. If a barbarian falls {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}, her rage immediately ends.
398d085c-d71f-4368-a22d-edf20732562e: A barbarian is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields).
49d758ad-3b8f-42cc-8ed1-9aae8a6060aa: A barbarian's land {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is faster than the norm for her {g|Encyclopedia:Race}race{/g} by +10 feet. This benefit applies only when she is wearing no armor, light armor, or medium armor, and not carrying a heavy load. Apply this {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} before modifying the barbarian's speed because of any load carried or armor worn. This bonus stacks with any other bonuses to the barbarian's land speed.
bcecd700-2f8e-4454-a4f2-fb2f2da537c3: A monk gains immunity to poisons of all kinds.
7fc793c7-7cd8-4c9c-b471-fa3378124c13: An armored hulk gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} and to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}, and on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saves{/g} against trample {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. She also gains a +1 bonus to her {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against charge attacks and on attack and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against charging creatures.
56dc0b64-d582-4ea4-8a9b-ee2b47264849: An instinctual warrior adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} bonus (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
bf230926-9e3e-46b1-9f77-f2d4fd8cae4d:
An instinctual warrior can call upon inner reserves of strength and ferocity, granting her additional combat prowess. At 1st level, an instinctual warrior can rage for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 4 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. For each level after 1st she possesses, the barbarian can rage for 2 additional rounds per day. Temporary increases to Wisdom do not increase the total number of rounds that an instinctual warrior can rage per day. An instinctual warrior can enter a rage as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. The total number of rounds of rage per day is renewed after resting for 8 hours, although these hours need not be consecutive.
While in a rage, an instinctual warrior gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and Wisdom. In addition, she gains 2 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}. These temporary hit points are lost first when a character takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, disappear when the rage ends, and are not replenished if the barbarian enters a rage again within 1 minute of her previous rage. While in a rage, an instinctual warrior cannot cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
An instinctual warrior can end her rage as a free {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, and is fatigued for 1 minute after a rage ends. An instinctual warrior can't enter a new rage while fatigued or exhausted, but can otherwise enter a rage multiple times per day. If an instinctual warrior falls {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}, her rage immediately ends.
095cbb1a-47ef-437b-b4ea-982fee32a25d:
An instinctual warrior can take Improved Unarmed Strike as a bonus rage power. The {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dealt by a Medium instinctual warrior's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike increases with level: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} at levels 1–3, 1d8 at levels 4–7, 1d10 at levels 8–11, 2d6 at levels 12–15, 2d8 at levels 16–19, and 2d10 at level 20.
If the instinctual warrior is Small, his unarmed strike damage increases as follows: 1d4 at levels 1–3, 1d6 at levels 4–7, 1d8 at levels 8–11, 1d10 at levels 12–15, 2d6 at levels 16–19, and 2d8 at level 20.
If the instinctual warrior is Large, his unarmed strike damage increases as follows: 1d8 at levels 1–3, 2d6 at levels 4–7, 2d8 at levels 8–11, 3d6 at levels 12–15, 3d8 at levels 16–19, and 4d8 at level 20.
b77c5b47-fba6-45ef-b894-8bdd42d63289: An instinctual warrior gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to his current barbarian level + 10. In order to affect the instinctual warrior with a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, a spellcaster must get a result on a {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + caster level) that equals or exceeds the instinctual warrior 's spell resistance.
4819ebf4-4e66-418b-b20a-b9fa53fe2aec: An instinctual warrior is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g} and shields (except tower shields).
8ce88466-54a1-4efd-a16a-e36dd7836021: As a barbarian gains levels, she learns to use her rage in new ways. Starting at 2nd level, a barbarian gains a rage power. She gains another rage power for every two levels of barbarian attained after 2nd level. A barbarian gains the benefits of rage powers only while raging, and some of these powers require the barbarian to take an {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} first. Unless otherwise noted, a barbarian cannot select an individual power more than once.
19cbdb0c-5fd9-4f56-bcef-d5ca86db0f86: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the barbarian heals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of damage + her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. For every 4 levels the barbarian has beyond 4th, the amount healed increases by 1d8 (to a maximum of 5d8 at 20th level). This ability can be used only once per day. The barbarian must be at least 4th level to select this rage power.
985b9e6b-d00d-4098-a591-90f37230e837:
As an instinctual warrior gains levels, she learns to use her rage in new ways. Starting at 4 level, an instinctual warrior gains a rage power. She gains another rage power on 8th, 10th, 12th, 16th, 18th and 20th levels. An instinctual warrior gains the benefits of rage powers only while raging, and some of these powers require the instinctual warrior to take an {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} first. Unless otherwise noted, an instinctual warrior cannot select an individual power more than once.
She also can take additional abilities as rage power which work when an instinctual warrior rages. These abilities are: Diamond Soul, Diamond Body, Deflect Arrows, Perfect Self and Purity of Body.
46dbc9b0-53cc-491a-a369-882bc921954c: At 10th level, a mad dog gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. At 13th level and every 3 barbarian levels thereafter, this {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction rises by 1, to a maximum of DR 4/— at 19th level. A mad dog's war beast gains the same damage reduction as the mad dog.
a5bc9182-27f6-46c2-8a1f-4457b765a593: At 11th level, a barbarian's {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} while raging increases to +3. In addition, the amount of temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} gained when entering a rage increases to 3 per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}.
ea74b612-03b1-4a35-ba3c-e4c058f9c185: At 11th level, an instinctual warrior's {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} while raging increases to +3. In addition, the amount of temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} gained when entering a focused rage increases to 3 per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}hit die{/g}.
ad732799-d053-4781-bdc9-28980910cfb1: At 12th level, when entering a rage, a beastkin berserker can take the form of a Large bear. This functions as beast shape III, except the duration is for as long as the beastkin berserker rages.
9f66cb22-f3f6-4520-9520-3d18a6256304: At 14th level, whenever her war beast succeeds at a bull rush, overrun, or trip {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} against an opponent threatened by the mad dog, a mad dog can take an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} against that opponent.
54fb5d27-2c49-462a-b183-c9df32445929: At 1st level, a mad dog gains the service of an animal companion, using the barbarian's level as her effective druid level.
6ba78564-894e-48e7-92b4-93ce3941a788: At 20th level, a barbarian's {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} while raging increases to +4. In addition, the amount of temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} gained when entering a rage increases to 4 per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}.
1b6b530c-73dd-4cb8-8cf2-97bd916179c0: At 20th level, a monk becomes a magical creature. The monk gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 10/chaotic, which allows him to ignore the first 10 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} made by a nonchaotic weapon or by any {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attack{/g} made by a creature that doesn't have similar damage reduction.
a8485c0a-117c-40c4-809f-6e0808ece448: At 20th level, an instinctual warrior's {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} while raging increases to +4. In addition, the amount of temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} gained when entering a focused rage increases to 4 per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}.
af114d4b-93f5-4adb-9c5e-2700b602afeb: At 2nd level and every 4 levels thereafter, the pack rager can take a bonus teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. This teamwork feat must also be a combat feat.
a298d44c-82f6-4b5b-81f6-c2785d2b0f6d: At 2nd level, a mad dog and her war beast gain a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} while {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanking{/g} the same opponent (instead of the normal +2 bonus).
036c73a6-0071-4bdc-8747-6accf89ac92a: At 2nd level, an armored hulk moves 5 feet faster than normal in medium and heavy armor.
27cc8165-bb66-45ee-91c1-4bb9202ce0b0: At 2nd level, the invulnerable rager gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g}/— equal to half her barbarian level. Damage reduction can reduce {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to 0 but not below 0.
44e65c8b-4c95-4b36-b3d2-631991bf351e: At 3rd level, a barbarian gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saves{/g} to avoid traps and a +1 dodge bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} by traps. These bonuses increase by 1 every 3 levels thereafter (to a maximum of +6 at 18th level).
85f562b7-030b-4d19-a043-3dc54049acdb: At 3rd level, an armored hulk is able to use her armor to help avoid deadly hits. While wearing heavy armor, she gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} that applies only on {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} confirmation {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 every 3 levels beyond 3rd (maximum +6 at 18th level).
40d62869-cbe5-4e60-a54f-dc267eacf4d9: At 3rd level, the invulnerable rager gains 1 point of fire resistance and 1 point of cold resistance. At 6th level and every 3 levels thereafter, these resistances increase by 1 point (up to 6 points at 18th level).
649e5002-bf21-46d8-a8e6-b85a1ecebce8: At 4th level, when entering a rage, a beastkin berserker can take the form of a Medium wolf. This functions as beast shape I, except the duration is for as long as the beastkin berserker rages.
0633a613-4e97-4c89-9c2e-090df0096d36:
At 5th level, a mad dog's war beast gains Trip as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
Trip: This feat gives the character an ability to perform the trip {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g}. It also grants a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}CMB{/g} when performing this maneuver, and a +2 bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} when defending against it.
You can attempt to trip your opponent in place of a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}. If your combat maneuver is successful, the target is knocked prone.
If the target has more than two legs, add +2 to the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of the combat maneuver {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g} for each additional leg it has. Some creatures — such as oozes, creatures without legs, and flying creatures — cannot be tripped.
175e97dd-8f13-4b66-9878-750453a3d13f: At 5th level, a monk gains immunity to all diseases, including supernatural and magical diseases.
0dbeff09-ad8a-4231-9655-6bc6169bfdc6: At 5th level, an armored hulk moves faster in medium and heavy armor. When wearing medium or heavy armor, an armored hulk can move 10 feet faster than normal, to a maximum of her {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
3c99a4f3-da63-4ff8-b2ab-e281e205de36: At 7th level, a barbarian gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. Subtract 1 from the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} the barbarian takes each time she is dealt damage from a weapon or a {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attack{/g}. At 10th level, and every three barbarian levels thereafter (13th, 16th, and 19th level), this damage reduction rises by 1 point. Damage reduction can reduce damage to 0 but not below 0.
1bfd4deb-cac3-46e3-afcd-3a842d5d06b6:
At 7th level, while a pack rager is raging, she grants a single teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} she has to all allies within 50 feet who can see and hear her. She chooses the feat at the start of the rage, and cannot change it during the rage. An ally who moves more than 50 feet away from the raging pack rager loses access to the feat, but regains it again each time he moves back within 50 feet of the raging pack rager. Allies do not need to meet the prerequisites of these teamwork feats.
At 13th level, the pack rager chooses two teamwork feats when she enters a rage, and grants her allies the use of both of those feats when they are within 50 feet of her.
At 19th level, the pack rager chooses three teamwork feats when she enters a rage, and grants her allies the use of all three feats when they are within 50 feet of her.
7d7c0533-126b-4da9-9d5b-8852221b3d6e: At 8th level, when entering a rage, a beastkin berserker can take the form of a Medium leopard. This functions as beast shape II, except the duration is for as long as the beastkin berserker rages.
e6fc2375-661c-47d5-8d8c-de15f1c7ffc2: Barbarian rages can be a thing of savage beauty, exhibiting a lethal grace. While such uncontrolled displays of carnage often disregard group tactics, there are those barbarians whose rages inspire and spur on their allies during the ferocious dance of death.
19ad4a6a-7659-4385-822a-a635f57bad4c: Barbarians are melee warriors who plunge into rage to deal the enemies a lot of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. They move fast and have a lot of {g|Encyclopedia:HP}health{/g}, but are poorly armored. As they advance, the barbarians gain immunity to some of the enemies' tactical advantages.
4552773a-63ca-411e-ae96-4d888a9045f8: Barbarians can choose passive or activated powers that make some of their abilities stronger while weakening the others, and only work while the barbarian is raging. Only one activated power can work at the same time.
5b0bc6e0-f5cd-4e60-97e2-7236092e2531: Barbarians excel in combat, possessing the martial prowess and fortitude to take on foes seemingly far superior to themselves. With rage granting them boldness and daring beyond that of most other warriors, barbarians charge furiously into battle and ruin all who would stand in their way.
cf9c74c5-9fb9-4e4d-8faf-3717fb2efb15: Beastkin berserker adds half her level (minimum 1) on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} (when used to intimidate) {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}.
21f2e9f5-aa42-43b2-a338-4e8ab17cb008: If the barbarian scores a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} threat while in the lethal stance, she applies double the lethal stance's {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} when {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolling{/g} to confirm the critical. A barbarian must have the lethal stance rage power and be at least 4th level to select this rage power.
d001a9ff-d09d-4d52-a7db-b9a1a7edd4c1: Some barbarians disdain the hides and leather used as armor by most of their kin. Instead they master the heaviest of armors, even those created by more civilized people, to gain greater protection and stability in battle.
ca982e97-1476-4b79-b420-770b961edd47: Some barbarians learn to take whatever comes their way, shrugging off mortal wounds with ease. These barbarians invite their enemies to attack them, and use pain to fuel their rage.
bf152c61-b196-437b-a08d-d7a533fb8358: Some people consider barbarians savages driven by rage and animal instincts. Instinctual warriors represent the opposite picture. They are concentrated fighters who are so adept at controlling their rage that they can fight blind, relying on only a sixth sense.
8cce2ac0-01a6-4e7a-bd89-4aa21dbbcfd6: Starting at 17th level, a barbarian no longer becomes fatigued at the end of her rage.
8fb66ac5-95af-4745-bf10-96a4400f3b7f: Starting at 17th level, an instinctual warrior no longer becomes fatigued at the end of her rage.
a0a29474-356e-4330-8e2c-889c49cb2a56: The barbarian can continually replenish her {g|Encyclopedia:HP}health{/g}. At the start of her turn, she regains 1 temporary hit point for every 4 levels she has (up to 5 hit points per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}), but this cannot give her more than her maximum temporary hit points from rage. This is a stance rage power. A barbarian must have the renewed vigor rage power and be at least 4th level to select this rage power.
89d5baf1-2268-4798-b16a-82c1638c4534:
The barbarian can focus her ferocity. She gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} and thrown weapon damage rolls. This bonus increases by 1 for every 4 levels the barbarian has.
This is a stance rage power. A barbarian can't have more than one stance rage power active at a time. If she activates a stance rage power while another one is active, the current stance immediately ends.
bc006973-1ef8-40b1-bd6b-f8f2646589a7:
The barbarian can focus her strikes. She gains a +1 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls and thrown weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}. This bonus increases by 1 for every 4 levels the barbarian has.
This is a stance rage power. A barbarian can't have more than one stance rage power active at a time. If she activates a stance rage power while another one is active, the current stance immediately ends.
e25c368c-1372-4fbd-bc59-18beeabc4dec:
The barbarian can take on a more defensive posture. This grants her a +1 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to her {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g} for the duration of her current rage. This bonus increases by 1 for every 4 levels the barbarian has.
This is a stance rage power. A barbarian can't have more than one stance rage power active at a time. If she activates a stance rage power while another one is active, the current stance immediately ends.
cfbd1d89-db28-469c-969b-dc5af4550b54:
The barbarian can {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} with abandon at the expense of her defense. She gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on attack rolls, but takes a –1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. This bonus and penalty increase by 1 at 4th level and every 4 levels thereafter.
This is a stance rage power. A barbarian can't have more than one stance rage power active at a time. If she activates a stance rage power while another one is active, the current stance immediately ends.
31d19169-08db-41c6-b442-b884acc1984f: The barbarian gains a 10-foot enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to her base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}. A barbarian can select this rage power up to three times; its effects stack.
947fb65a-2126-4813-ae5a-e6eb18d58a0e: The barbarian gains the {g|Encyclopedia:Scent}scent{/g} ability while raging and can use this ability to locate unseen foes. The barbarian can detect opponents within 30 feet by sense of smell as if she had {g|Encyclopedia:Blindsense}blindsense{/g}.
8d80118c-bcb9-46b6-bd15-c1699296e549: The barbarian is immune to the shaken and frightened conditions. A barbarian must be at least 12th level to select this rage power.
1c7f5127-dad9-4d3c-ab00-3591cd7525c4: The barbarian is immune to the sickened and nauseated conditions. A barbarian must be at least 8th level to select this rage power.
888053ce-c565-42a4-8045-b0031ca2170c: The barbarian unlocks a new ability to use while raging. She gains one additional rage power. She must meet all of the prerequisites for this rage power. This {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} can be taken multiple times.
a3ba8e9e-2ddd-4405-8558-7ecf1475497d: The barbarian's dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} from Guarded Stance is doubled against {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g} while Guarded Stance is active. A barbarian must have the Guarded Stance rage power and be at least 6th level to select this rage power.
e46db326-68f6-4dbc-88de-42778ff1de32: The barbarian's {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} increases by 2/—. A barbarian can select this rage power up to three times. Its effects stack. A barbarian must be at least 8th level to select this rage power.
e30cbe34-df9c-4818-99c0-0889fdf7236e: The extremely developed sixth sense of the instinctual warrior allows him to have a {g|Encyclopedia:Blindsense}blindsense{/g} to a range of 30 feet, blindsight to a range of 15 feet.
a273f5b5-f4c1-442a-8aed-f9fce70233f1: This ability allows the character to react to a danger faster than others. Thanks to it, they can evade a {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to their {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}armor class{/g} in some situations, and become immune to some of the enemies' tactical advantages.
7b736cff-4beb-4813-a16d-6f1c168e600c: This ability temporarily increases the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} power, {g|Encyclopedia:HP}health{/g} and the ability to resist hostile control, but also decreases defense. After the rage ends, the character gets fatigued and becomes weaker for a short time.
956bf521-3bf0-4758-b937-b15e1627e17e: Though named for the wild savages who fight alongside rabid dogs, mad dogs employ all manner of beasts as their battle brethren.
81325da4-97c0-4998-bf41-f24a16560a27: Unlike normal animals of its kind, an animal companion's {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}, abilities, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} advance as the druid advances in level. If a character receives an animal companion from more than one source, her effective druid levels stack for the purposes of determining the statistics and abilities of the companion. Most animal companions increase in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} when their druid reaches 4th or 7th level, depending on the companion.
6f6a578a-bb11-4412-bb20-6e3eda3c4b6c: When an ally who also has this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} confirms a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} against an opponent that you also {g|Encyclopedia:Threatened_Area}threaten{/g}, you can make an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} against that opponent.
610a829d-b56c-4c47-8aee-5f3c71e8d24d: When unarmored and not wielding a shield, the instinctual warrior adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} bonus (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. In addition, an instinctual warrior gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to AC and CMD at 4th level. This bonus increases by 1 for every four barbarian levels thereafter, up to a maximum of +5 at 20th level.
0388dfc5-4a88-41e3-bd31-2eacb5f26f89: Whenever the barbarian kills a living creature with CR equal to at least half her {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g} while raging, she heals 5 {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}. If she is already at her maximum number of hit points, she instead gains 5 temporary hit points, which don't stack if she kills multiple creatures.
e8e26619-8993-407e-8c8e-842fa82c8714: Whenever you and an ally who also has this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} are {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanking{/g} the same creature, you deal an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of precision {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with each successful {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}. This bonus damage stacks with other sources of precision damage, such as sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. This bonus damage is not multiplied on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}.
3d4db4eb-2ff5-4988-8bfe-284e3ed555c3: Whenever you and an ally who also has this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} are {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanking{/g} the same creature, your flanking {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} increases to +4. In addition, whenever you score a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} against the flanked creature, it provokes an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} from your ally.
09984ae2-044d-4e44-bed2-6aa4ed9ba655: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, you receive a +2 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}Combat Maneuver Defense{/g}. This bonus increases to +4 if the creature attempting the {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}maneuver{/g} is larger than both you and your ally.
189ac618-529d-4b7c-976e-0aced6078521:
Whenever you are wielding a shield and are adjacent to an ally wielding a shield who also has this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, the {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} from your shield increases, depending on the shield wielded by your ally.
If your ally is wielding a buckler or a light shield, your shield bonus increases by +1.
If your ally is wielding a heavy shield or a tower shield, your shield bonus increases by +2.
d2860f31-984c-4f01-b635-771c2bb3bc7c: While in a rage, an instinctual warrior gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}. In addition, she gains 2 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}.
6ec561bd-f295-4df3-8ce6-c1fbcb479be7: While in rage, a barbarian gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. In addition, she takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. She also gains 2 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}.
56d061b7-5aa0-46f7-b43a-239d899fb2d9: While in rage, a barbarian of 14th level or higher gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resist Enchantment spells{/g}. This bonus stacks with all other modifiers, including the morale bonus on Will saves she also receives during her rage.
9163e156-d7d5-4265-a894-5fb8ec766b89: While in the guarded stance, the barbarian can apply her dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} as a bonus on Reflex {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. A barbarian must have the guarded stance rage power and be at least 6th level to select this rage power.
31fe1e94-48da-4992-81eb-13683aeb2360: While in the guarded stance, the barbarian gains an additional +4 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} made to confirm {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}. A barbarian must have the guarded stance rage power and be at least 8th level to select this rage power.
67d77539-f40a-4f55-8704-8c882bc55664: While in the lethal stance, the barbarian's {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} multiplier for {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} increases by 1 (a ×2 multiplier becomes ×3, a ×3 multiplier becomes ×4, and a ×4 multiplier becomes ×5). A barbarian must have the lethal stance and deadly accuracy rage powers and be at least 16th level to select this rage power.
26702921-99f1-4e39-8f8c-24fed53e62f8: While in the powerful stance, every first successful {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} in a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} applies a -1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} for one round. This penalty increases by 1 point and duration increases for 1 round for every 4 levels the barbarian has beyond 8. A barbarian must have the Powerful Stance rage power and be at least 8th level to select this rage power.
885eeafd-b263-439b-b060-e7a5010c8bdf: While in the powerful stance, the barbarian can make an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} that causes her enemies to bleed profusely. Her melee and thrown weapon attacks deal additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. This {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} increases by 1 for every 4 levels the barbarian has beyond 12. This damage bypasses {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} and doesn't multiply on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. Barbarian must have the powerful stance rage power and be at least 12th level to select this rage power.
004a8a08-5886-4e0f-bcb4-150b32470f63: While in the reckless stance, the barbarian imparts the stance's {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to all willing allies within 30 feet of her. A barbarian must have the reckless stance rage power to select this rage power.
fe491e53-7924-48fa-b05e-31865ebd908d: While raging, the barbarian gains a +1 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels the barbarian has attained. Note: Totem rage powers grant powers related to a theme. A barbarian cannot select from more than one group of totem rage powers; for example, a barbarian who selects a beast totem rage power cannot later choose to gain any of the dragon totem rage powers (any rage power with "dragon totem" in its title).
f058543b-cf04-46eb-b3c1-dce296dcf086: While raging, the barbarian gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g}, death effects, disease, and poison. This bonus increases by 1 for each daemon totem rage power the barbarian has, excluding this one.
a90910fc-9106-48e4-8dba-05956d6e82d7: While raging, the barbarian gains a bite {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. If used as part of a full attack, the bite attack is made at the barbarian's full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} –5. If the bite hits, it deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (assuming the barbarian is Medium; 1d3 points of damage if {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Small{/g}) plus half the barbarian's {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier.
dac75309-7bcc-473e-903a-8da350c0d200: While raging, the barbarian gains the pounce {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g}, allowing her to make a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} at the end of a charge. In addition, the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from her claws increases to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} (1d6 if {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Small{/g}) and the claws deal ×3 damage on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. Note: Totem rage powers grant powers related to a theme. A barbarian cannot select from more than one group of totem rage powers; for example, a barbarian who selects a beast totem rage power cannot later choose to gain any of the dragon totem rage powers (any rage power with "dragon totem" in its title).
37ff35a5-69b6-4869-a26a-b0d68cedd08b: While raging, the barbarian gains two claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. These attacks are considered primary attacks and are made at the barbarian's full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. The claws deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}slashing damage{/g} (1d4 if {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Small{/g}) plus the barbarian's {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier. Note: Totem rage powers grant powers related to a theme. A barbarian cannot select from more than one group of totem rage powers; for example, a barbarian who selects a beast totem rage power cannot later choose to gain any of the dragon totem rage powers (any rage power with "dragon totem" in its title).
4935fabe-5046-42ff-9f56-d23c74ae64c1: While raging, the barbarian gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to 11 + the barbarian's {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with the evil descriptor. She also gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against spells and effects from evil creatures.
3d36c3c9-06af-4dc5-8453-46a5eb89957b: While raging, the barbarian grows a pair of large horns, gaining a gore {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. This attack is a primary attack (unless she is also attacking with weapons, in which case it is a secondary attack) and is made at the barbarian's full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} (–5 if it is a secondary attack). The gore attack deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g} (1d6 if {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Small{/g}) plus the barbarian's {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier (1/2 if it is a secondary attack).
4be1f840-9442-4df6-9465-ea9f1543817b: While raging, the barbarian is surrounded by an aura of menace. Good creatures adjacent to the barbarian are shaken and take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}slashing damage{/g} at the beginning of the barbarian's turn as dozens of small cuts open across their flesh. Neutral creatures that are adjacent to the barbarian are shaken, but do not take any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Evil creatures are unaffected.
f304a30e-52aa-4e0f-9157-ab22337a2834: While raging, the barbarian sprouts dozens of wicked barbs from her body. Anyone striking the barbarian with a melee weapon, an {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike, or a {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapon{/g} takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g}.
f6a82074-04a2-4245-9d0e-fcb4a44641c5: While raging, the spirits that surround the barbarian make it difficult for her enemies to see her. The spirits grant the barbarian a 20% miss chance against {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} made by creatures that are not adjacent to the barbarian (such as {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} weapons).
346228a3-5ff4-4ba2-a202-65b19202bbb6: While raging, this effect bestows upon the barbarian a halo of gleaming light that shines as if it were daylight and triggers an invisibility purge effect in the barbarian's square and each adjacent square. The invisibility purge only affects non-good creatures.
b3c01295-1b50-46b8-a892-656681330616: While raging, whenever barbarian is subject to a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or a non-spell healing effect that cures {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit point{/g} damage, she heals 1 additional point of damage per her {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g}. This does not affect {g|Encyclopedia:Fast_Healing}fast healing{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Regeneration}regeneration{/g}.
61066e97-edd6-4d3a-a5d3-87d5a944d84a: While some barbarians take on bestial aspects in their rages, the beastkin berserker descends so deeply into primal fury that she actually transforms into an animal. Berserkers of the surface world often associate with predators such as bears or wolves, and are sometimes mistaken for lycanthropes. Some barbarians shapechange into rampaging dinosaurs or megafauna, crafting their armor out of the hide and bones of their favored animals.
1882dc5f-dcd8-4a84-994e-e800e0066ced: While the barbarian is raging, her {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} impose a temporary negative level on her opponent on a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. After 1 hour, these temporary negative levels disappear automatically (without a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g}).
7753e2e5-5b3c-4e73-a468-78fbcba4c4ec:
With the aid of an ally, you are skilled at piercing the protections of other creatures with your {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
Benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, you receive a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} and level {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made to overcome {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}.
c5dce295-407e-490a-97b9-6015a73647a9:
You are skilled at working with your allies to perform dangerous {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuvers{/g}.
Benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, you receive a +2 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all combat maneuver {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}. This bonus increases to +4 when attempting to break free from a grapple.
de008a8a-31c6-4dc7-80da-1737f877d63e:
You have trained to work in ranks of archers to rain arrows down upon your foes.
Benefit: You gain a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g} rolls for each ally with this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} who made a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} since the end of your last turn against a target within 15 feet of your target, to a maximum of +4.
de38a457-9e2f-4a6f-8952-614d859d0369:
You know how to work together to trip your foes.
Benefit: Whenever you attempt a trip {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} against an enemy {g|Encyclopedia:Threatened_Area}threatened{/g} by an ally with this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, you {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} twice and take the better result.
19ac750e-84ce-40ea-a4cb-f64f78830ecf: You must have at least one hand free (holding nothing) to use this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. Once per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} when you would normally be hit with an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} from a ranged weapon, you may deflect it so that you take no {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from it. You must be aware of the attack and not {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g}. Attempting to deflect a {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g} doesn't count as an {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}.
9e4d4b4a-40ec-4dea-a2d0-dcab4b92668d:
Your allies cover you while you cast complicated {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
Benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, you receive a +4 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g}.
If your ally is wielding a buckler or a light shield, this bonus increases by +1.
If your ally is wielding a heavy shield or a tower shield, this bonus increases by +2.
2ac001a4-559e-46c1-9a3b-163fd3ee02bd:
Your ally's eyes are your own, and yours are his.
Benefit: While you are {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanked{/g} and adjacent to an ally with this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, you receive a +2 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} from opponents flanking you.
